item.title: Consider pricing and marketing strategies for successful product launches in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Almost 75% of new products launched in the Asia-Pacific region fail. This rate surpasses other global regions, according to a study by strategy consultants Simon Kucher & Partners. The study, Global Pricing Study 2014, was conducted in partnership with the Professional Pricing Society (PPS). [Image of watches for sale in a shopping district] Globally, the ability to implement price increases is declining. While companies in 2012 could successfully implement 50% of planned price increases, that number has fallen to about 33% in 2014.
